intro: Pentathymelaea thibetensis, commonly known as the Tibetan pentathymelaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Tibet and adjacent areas in China. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
